title: Edge Stream Processing
summary: Implements edge stream processing to handle data transformations and filtering at the edge, minimizing data transfer and improving throughput.

title: Enhanced Consumer Caching for Stream Processing
summary: Optimizes consumer caching mechanisms to reduce latency and improve throughput in stream processing.

title: Enhance Stream Processing for Low Latency
summary: Improves the stream processing capabilities to ensure low-latency data handling for real-time analytics.

title: Edge Stream Notification Enhancements
summary: Enhances the notification system to trigger alerts based on edge stream data analysis, improving real-time data handling.

title: Feedback Stream Integration
summary: Implements a new connector to stream user feedback data into Kafka topics for real-time processing.

title: Bandwidth-Efficient Topic Synchronization
summary: Introduces new protocols to reduce bandwidth usage during topic synchronization across distributed Kafka brokers.

title: Implement TLS Encryption for Data Streams
summary: Introduces TLS encryption to secure data streams between Kafka brokers and clients.

title: Dual Broker System for Seamless Data Streaming
summary: Sets up a dual broker system to maintain continuous data streaming during broker upgrades or failures.

title: Schema Registry Compatibility Check
summary: Implements a compatibility check for new schemas against existing data streams to ensure seamless integration.

title: Data Sync Latency in Replication
summary: Replication lag causes consumers to receive outdated messages, impacting real-time data processing.

title: Incorrect Consumer Group Offsets
summary: Messages are being consumed by the wrong consumer group due to offset misconfiguration, leading to data processing errors.

title: Delayed Message Propagation
summary: Significant delays in message delivery between producers and consumers, affecting real-time data processing.

title: Message Queue Overflow
summary: High volume of incoming messages causes the broker to slow down, delaying message delivery to consumers.

title: Priority Inversion in Message Processing
summary: Low-priority messages are being processed before high-priority ones, causing delays in critical data streams.
